With a smile, she headed further into the building, following her usual path right to the fiction section. The library's website had said the new "Murder Wives" book was in; it had been checked out for nearly four months now, and she was dying to read it.

She plucked it from the shelf, but before she could head to check out something else caught her eye. Another book, titled "Blueberry Cobbler Killer." By the same author, about the same subject... She grabbed it to, and started for the reading section.

Cynthia preferred to not check out a book if she wasn't going to enjoy it, so whenever she stumbled upon a new series she took a few minutes to read the first chapter. Sitting in one of the plush chairs, she made herself comfortable and cracked open the book.

It was good. Very good. In fact, Cynthia soon found herself lost in the pages, forgetting the world around her as she kept reading. And so, when her foot began to have a slight itch, she just unconsciously kicked her shoes off and kept reading, unaware of and uncaring for the consequences of this act.
131331121211221112.title: Reading Corner

choices: Stuck with the ant
Struck out by yourself
13133112121122112.content:
If you ever, ever saw another foot again, it'd be too soon.

You lay on top of a rotting banana peel, breathing in the rotting air, thankful to smell and taste something other than foot sweat. The little drop had dislodged you from the flip-flop, so in theory you were free. In practice, you were trapped in a metal cylinder the height of the Space Needle, but it was still an improvement.

Very little was visible in the darkness. When you finally worked up the will to stand and begin searching for an exit, you had to go slowly. The last thing you wanted was to have survived half a day of trampling just to break a leg and starve in the garbage. It was hard to traverse the slippery ground at first, but you found a shattered toothpick and used it as a makeshift walking stick.

You were crossing a field of coffee grounds and eggshells (jeez, hadn't she heard of composting?) when a scurrying sound broke the silence. You crouch, still, worried that a rat or something was about to break in and consume you. To your surprise, you watch an ant mount an apple core near you. It was maybe the size of a horse to you, and was moving over the rough terrain without a problem.

Remember "Honey I Shrunk the Kids?" You sprinted at the air. With a leap, you land on its back. The exoskeleton was rough, and felt like a weird cross between steel and ceramic. You gripped tightly as the ant continued on its way. Hopefully, the bug would know a way out of here, and once you were free you could dismount at your pleasure.

Sure enough, after finding a bagel crumb the size of a small car, the ant headed home. It scaled the side of the black plastic bag, and slipped through the smallest of openings between the can and the lid. You held on well enough, minus a few scares during vertical parts, and was greeted to the wide expanse of the kitchen floor. Suddenly, dismounting the ant didn't seem like such a good idea. What would you do all by yourself on such a huge plain of tile? What if the woman came back and crushed you under her feet again? The ant, however, was an expert at surviving and not being stepped on; if you stuck with it, at least for a while more, you might be able to escape here.

Clutching tightly to your walking stick, you...
13133112121122112.title: The Pioneers Used to Ride These Babies For Miles

choices: you were on top of the ant that escaped
you were on top of one of the ants she sprayed
131331121211221121.content:
Cynthia walked back into the kitchen, wanting a glass of water. Upon flicking the light on she immediately noticed several black specks scurrying about on her kitchen floor.

"Ugh! Ants!" she exclaimed. Two made their way straight for her bare feet and she recoiled in disgust. Dashing over to the kitchen counter, she pulled a can of Raid out and began spraying the intruders.

"Goddamn pests," she muttered under her breath. "I thought we were rid of these!"

Grabbing a napkin, Cynthia kneeled down and dabbed up the bodies of the dead bugs and tossed them in the trash. She inspected the floor one last time and saw a lone ant running from her towards the corner of the room.

'Oh no you don't,' Cynthia thought to herself as she grabbed the can and gave chase, but the ant slipped into a crack in the wall before she could finish it. Sighing, Cynthia stood back up and turned to the trash, tying the bag up. If there was any more of those insects in the bag she wanted to make sure they'd go outside. She slipped her feet into a pair of moccasins by the door and took the trash outside, dumping into the can and closing the lid.

Walking back into the house, the woman grabbed a tape dispenser from the closet and went back over to the crack in the wall. She applied the tape over the crack, sealing it shut, hoping to stop the ants from getting in. When that was done she finally poured herself a glass of water and went back to the living room.

"Next time I'm calling the exterminator." she muttered, returning to her show.
131331121211221121.title: Pests

choices: Head back into Cynthia's house
Head into the neighborhood at large
1313311212112211211.content:
Your ant (who you had begun to affectionately call 'Bridget') joined up with more of his kind near the base of the fridge. Together, they formed a sort of insect convoy, and gathering their scraps of food for the journey to the colony. You watched in awe from Bridget's back as the met up, tapping each other with feelers and sharing the heavier loads. They were a unit, well connected and able to act as one. Wordlessly, they set out.

Almost immediately the group leaves the relative shelter of the wall and begins crossing the open tile floor. The room stretches out for miles, an unbroken expanse of clean, green tile. You clutch tightly to Bridget's carapace; the sudden emptiness had left you woozy, and you had no desire to be left behind.

Five, ten minutes passed uneventfully. They walked on, tapping the ground with long feelers, making incredible progress that you never could have matched. Then from an open doorway came the woman. Her face and upper body were foreign and masked in shadow besides, but her feet, those unforgiving beasts that would crush and crush and crush without mercy, they were very familiar. She flicked a switch, and a blinding light flooded from above.

"Ahh! Move, Bridget, move!" You smacked the side of the ant, trying to kick it into action before she noticed the convoy. The ant remained unaware, but the towering woman's eyes drifted in your direction. She leaned in, her face taking up the sky, her lips curling back in a grimace. It was as if the moon made a face.

"Ugh! Ants!" Her words came with a gust of wind and threatened your grip on Bridget. Still, the ants moved on. The lead two were getting very close to the woman's toes, which were curling up in disgust. For a split second you feared for them, recalling your time in Mrs. Stevenson's care, but before you could do anything the feet were gone.

Not gone; away. For something so big, the woman moved fast. You watched her cross the room in seconds flat to begin digging around in some dusty cupboard. She turned around again, a can clasped in her grip. Fear struck as you recognized the Raid brand label; you survived a footstep, but could you take a chemical shower?

On instinct more than anything you grabbed for your walking stick, shouting "Sorry Bridget!" as you plunged it into the insect's rear. It reared up, wrenching the stick from your grasp as it charged forward at top speed, rushing past the other ants who still had not sensed the danger. A crack in the wall, likely the convoy's original goal, loomed ahead, but behind was a terrible slaughter. You watched as the woman bent over your group, and without a wasting a second began to spray. A cloud washed over the ants; walking instantly turned to running as they finally understood what was happening. It was too late, though, as the cloud grew thicker and the ants began to collapse, their legs twitching as they dropped their crumbs to the floor.

In seconds, they were all dead. A part wanted to go back and mourn them, but the woman was already wiping up the remains with a paper towel. She tossed them into the trash bin; you hoped that the garbage would be a suitable heaven for them.

You watched her face, hopeful she'd miss you. She didn't. Wielding the can of Raid she charged for you, but as her finger pressed down Bridget slipped into the crack.



Bridget had the strength to carry you outside of the house, and no more. You buried her in the soft dirt of the garden, near the little chip in the foundation she had carried you through. In the light of the setting sun, you said a few words, mourning that she and her family had to die for you to live.

As the moon rose, you looked out through the yard's tall grass. You were still just a speck in a very big world. You needed help, badly. But, from who?
1313311212112211211.title: Antz

choices: Had killed a tiny man
Had kidnapped a tiny man
131331121212.content:
"Hello, Mrs. Stev... Oh."

Autumn entered the dark office, shutting the door behind her. A quick glance around revealed she was alone. She quickly considers leaving and coming back another time, but another thought enters her mind.

Her work boots, covered in dried engine grease and mud, make no noise as they trod across the carpet. Autumn sits down at the computer, and glances around once more. Still alone.

Shaking the mouse, she wakes the machine back up. Luckily, Mrs. Stevenson hadn't bothered logging out. The admissions results were still up and ready to be tampered with.

"R... E... E... D... There! Summer Reed." A couple keystrokes later, and Autumn had changed her sister's score to just below perfect; enough to ensure her admission, but not enough to arouse suspicion.

As the grad student moved to leave, she stepped on something, a discarded shoe. Instinctively recoiling, her arm swept back, knocking a stack of papers off the desk and across the room. "Shit!" As quickly as possible, she moved around the room and grabbed up the papers, placing them back on the desk. Hopefully the admissions counselor wouldn't notice.

Work done, Autumn left, failing to notice that she...
131331121212.title: Cheating

1313311212121.content:
She was a looker, that was for sure. Perhaps your vantage point from the corner of the room was a bit... skewed, but you liked what you saw. Even dressed in greasy overalls and thick, black boots, this mystery girl had a certain appeal about her. Maybe you're only think that because this is the first time you've seen the whole body of a woman since Mrs. Stevenson showed you her sole.

Speaking of Mrs. Stevenson, that's who this mystery girl seemed to be looking for. Yet, despite the office being empty (excepting you, of course), she stayed. Based on her shifty behavior, you couldn't help but feel like she wasn't supposed to be on the computer over there. A heroic twinge starts up, but you're way too small to do anything to the mystery criminal.

Instead, you try to take the role of a passive observer. Once she leaves, you can make your escape.

"Shit!" You look up towards the source, and see a flurry of white: papers, and a lot to them. They scatter around you, and you cower into the carpet for safety. None of them hit you, but heading towards the mess (and thus you) are the big stomping feet of the criminal.

You try to run, but even as she slows to collect the papers the girl out speeds you. Her boot's in the air above you, and then it's on you. The treads in the sole were wide and thick, but would they land safely on you?

It turns out no. Thick, black rubber pushes you into the carpet. You try to scream, but your mouth fills with the taste of motor oil. The pressure increases as she squats down, and your head explodes.
1313311212121.title: Critical Hit

choices: Autumn's headed to her job at the auto shop
Autumn's headed to her apartment near the campus
1313311212122.content:
She was a looker, that was for sure. Perhaps your vantage point from the corner of the room was a bit... skewed, but you liked what you saw. Even dressed in greasy overalls and thick, black boots, this mystery girl had a certain appeal about her. Maybe you're only think that because this is the first time you've seen the whole body of a woman since Mrs. Stevenson showed you her sole.

Speaking of Mrs. Stevenson, that's who this mystery girl seemed to be looking for. Yet, despite the office being empty (excepting you, of course), she stayed. Based on her shifty behavior, you couldn't help but feel like she wasn't supposed to be on the computer over there. A heroic twinge starts up, but you're way too small to do anything to the mystery criminal.

Instead, you try to take the role of a passive observer. Once she leaves, you can make your escape.

"Shit!" You look up towards the source, and see a flurry of white: papers, and a lot to them. They scatter around you, and you cower into the carpet for safety. None of them hit you, but heading towards the mess (and thus you) are the big stomping feet of the criminal.

You try to run, but even as she slows to collect the papers the girl out speeds you. Her boot's in the air above you, and then it's on you. The treads in the sole were wide and thick, but would they land safely on you?

It turns out yes. The black rubber walls fall to either side. You try to stand, but a minor shift of her foot slams you into a caked bit of mud beside you. It sticks and holds your back.

The boot lifts up, and you go along with it. She steps about the room, bringing you high into the air before returning you to the carpet once more. The muddy grip on you is loose, but you know if you were to fall you'd likely end up under her steps.

The door above swings open, and you sigh as yet another person takes you on a foot joyride.
1313311212122.title: Direct Hit

choices: The tiny man broke free during the bike ride
The tiny man is still on Autumn's boot when she hits the garage
13133112121221.content:
Good deed done for the day, Autumn glanced down at her watch. "Shit! I'm gonna be late!"

She daren't run through the faculty rooms, but as soon as she hit the open air she took off running, her boots pounding through the campus until she reached her motorbike.

More of a classic than a cutting-edge machine, it had still gathered a small crowd of admiring students. Autumn offered a wry smile to a few of them as she put on her helmet, before bashing the kick-stand away and roaring off toward the garage.

On the bike, she was in her element, fast and free. It would almost be a shame that she'd have to stop when she reached the garage, were it not for the fact that her second favourite thing was tearing apart and putting together vehicles...
13133112121221.title: Biker Girl

choices: Autumn works on her own bike
Autumn works underneath a client's car
Autumn has to make drinks for her work colleagues
131331121212212.content:
Being under the shoe is a different experience to being under the foot. It does mean that, for some of the time, you are at least exposed to air, and no part of you is in direct contact with sweaty human flesh.

On the downside, that does mean a bigger, crueller contrast between the moments of calm, soaring through the blissful air, and the crunching realism as the boot crushes down onto varied surfaces. Face-down, you get an up-close interaction with thick, scratching carpet fibres, smooth, hard tiling, rugged and bruising concrete and even raw, dirty earth.

The woman smashes you up and down against so many types of harm, and your body is bruised and cut, your senses assaulted by the seismic pounding and the stenches of the larger world. Still the mud holds you tight, unwilling to let you go to relieve your tortured existence.

You're all too ready to pass out, to let go your own grip on life, when the regular steps cease, and the boot sits easy, your position in the treads exposed to a cooling wind that is cold comfort to your wrecked form. Looking down, you can see the ground far below you, and at the extent of craning your neck you can make out twisted spires of shiny metal, radiating out at all angles to meet with a curved surface of rough black material.

It's good thing that the woman kicks her motorbike into life with her other foot, as now you are free to relax as the vast machine supporting the giantess' mass rumbles into life, its roaring shudder - as loud and violent as an erupting volcano - relaxing in comparison to what you've already experienced.

Then the speed kicks in, wind whipping past you faster than you can think, the ground below too much of a blur for you to track where you're being taken.

The mud around you begins to dry and crack, flakes of it tumbling away into oblivion. You feel your own weight pulling you down in miniscule increments as less of it is supported. At the worst possible time, when a drop will be certain death! You clench your muscles, gripping as hard as you can with whatever you have available.

You needn't have worried. Why would this Goddess ever give you the merciful end of speed-kill, when she can torture you more? The journey stops with a continental lurch, one last clump of dried mud dropping from your forearm before the boot launches into space again.

And so, you are subjected once more to the continual tread of this woman while under her treads...
131331121212212.title: A Restful Ride

choices: The tiny man was splashed off in the puddle
The tiny man was dragged all the way home, in the hell of Autumn's footsteps
13133112121222.content:
Autumn slid her hands into the pockets of her overalls, innocently clumping out through the building. The perfect crime! No-one suspected what she'd done! And it had been so easy!

With a laugh of glee, she jumped in a nearby puddle, her heavy black boots splashing the water far and wide. On the look of passers-by, she shrugged. "Whatever."

Good thing it wasn't too far to her apartment; that puddle had merely been an omen of the skies beginning to open to pour rain, and here was Autumn without a jacket! In the end, she ran the last few yards to the front door, and kept on going up the stairs, stomping her feet down haphazardly.

At her own apartment she slowed as she fished the key out, and stepped over the threshold almost casually, scraping the dirt from her boots onto the mat rather than face another whinge from Natalie, possibly the most cleanliness-obsessed housemate one could ever wish to hate. Hopefully she wasn't home, as Autumn just wanted to crash...
13133112121222.title: Grunge

choices: You've been left on the welcome mat.
You're still clinging to Autumn's boots.
131331121212222.content:
Thoom!

With a thunderous jolt, your captor's foot slams into the hard concrete path. The force quivers through the worn rubber sole, your bones rattling as you clutch tightly to the clumps of mud that kept you from falling to the ground. As her foot settles, you glimpse down the hallway-like tread, taking in the poor condition of the material. Every surface you could see was chipped, dented, torn, and stained, and the entire world around you smelt like a mixture of old mud and stale sweat. Yet, as terrible as it was, it was infinitely preferable to falling loose and ending up under her treads instead of between them.

You've been clinging to this giant for a few minutes by now. It's a hell; never still, it swings you through the air at rocket speeds before plowing into the ground with thousands of pounds of force. Each step yanks at the bonds that hold you tight, each one feeling more and more like a deliberate attempt by the girl to knock you off and beneath her. Yet you know that's not the case. You're invisible down here. From the outside world it likely just looked like a normal, muddy boot, each heavy step the same as the last, each just as inconsequential as the previous. It tore at your ego, especially as you watched an ant about your size disappear beneath the girl's treads with a sickening crunch, all without her notice.

That's where you were, as you held on for your little life, trying to ignore the aches in your body as each subconscious twitch of the foot that lived just above your head threatened to shake you off, when without warning the giantess lifted her foot up higher than before. The rough ground below you, darkened by her shadow, shifts from the familiar footpath to the dark, frothing waters of a mud puddle.

"No, no, NO!" you scream, but it's already too late and a flood of warm, tepid water rushes over you. Your screams turn to gurgles as the boot settles in the puddle, while you desperately clutch and claw at the thick rubber around you. You couldn't be left here, you'd drown! The mud around you turns you mush, your hold to the sole beginning to fail. Then, with a loud slurping sound, her foot lifts again. The air hits you all at once, and you suck it down hungrily in the second you have, before the boot rushed back down into the water. This time, you couldn't stay attached, and you found yourself flung into the soft mud at the puddle's depths.

You didn't give in. With everything you had you kicked up, locked in a maze of tunnels formed by her treads but unwilling to die down here. You had only a moment, just seconds before she was gone, and as you felt the walls around you begin to lift, you found it; a tear, small, unimportant, between the shoe's tread and bottom, just big enough for you to jam yourself into.

Her foot lifted back into the air. You spit out a bunch of water, laughing as you feel the familiar rush of her step. She's moving faster now, but you're secure.

Or so you thought, until a loud scraping announces an intruder's arrival. You scream as thick black fibers reach up between the shoe's treads, knocking free looser clumps of dirt and debris. Your whole world has suddenly become a twisting, back and forth death zone, and with a gasp you realize...
131331121212222.title: Walk with me

choices: Natalie takes the mat outside to beat the dirt off it
Natalie picks up the mat to soak the dirt off in a tub
Natalie steps close to the mat, but does not choose to clean it yet
1313311212122221.content:
Fingers spread at her sides, Autumn treated her room-mate to a wide, sarcastic smile. "There? Happy now? Have I scraped enough mud off now? Can I enter my own home?" She stomped and raked her boots across the mat one final time for emphasis.

Her own arms folded, Natalie raised an eyebrow at Autumn's protests. Anyone would have thought that she was asking the girl to cut her arm off, not just perform a simple task that others did without even thinking about it. Had Autumn not noticed the mud and oil caked over her grungy boots?

Never would Natalie find herself in such a state. From the tips of her stylish, fluffy bunny slippers to the top of her neat, pixie-bob haircut, she kept herself immaculate. And it didn't take that much effort! She sighed as she remembered how much she had in common with her room-mate - only in matters of cleanliness were they an odd couple!

"Come on in," she relented. "Just take those boots off before you come in, huh? Coffee's on, and dinner should be done in a minute."

Autumn bowed sarcastically, but proceeded to step out of her boots and give Natalie a hug before moving on to the kitchen.

Natalie looked down at the dirty door-mat. It was beyond time that it got cleaned, itself...
1313311212122221.title: You're Welcome

choices: Autumn decides to scrub her boots clean
Autumn kicks her boots into a corner to clean later
Autumn leaves her boots on and just slips on some headphones
1313311212122222.content:
"Yeah, I'm not using that stupid mat," Autumn stated, paying lip service to the object with a quick swipe of her boots, before walking off to her room.

Natalie just stood with her mouth agape, unable to move from the tips of her stylish, fluffy bunny slippers to the top of her pixie bob haircut. Finally clamping her jaw shut and shaking her head, she resigned herself to another losing battle against her room-mate.

Autumn slumped down on her bed and let out a breath. She didn't dislike Nat, she just wasn't in the mood to be lectured on cleaning her boots. Looking at them now, down the length of her legs, she had to agree that they were much dirtier than usual. Maybe she should do something about that...
1313311212122222.title: Suited and Booted

choices: Right to the protestor
Away from the protestor
1313312.content:
You find yourself squeezed deep in the woman's pump; to your left is an immovable wall of flesh and to your right is another. Conditions are dark and damp, and truth be told you're not quite sure how you're still breathing. You've gone from man to lint in an instant, jarred about by the simplest of footsteps as you felt the woman's foot lift through the air and slam back on the ground. For a time, the steps stopped, replaced by a more regular vibration (and rougher toe-rubbing), but that too ended and she resumed her walk. The up and down, combined with the strong combination of foot and body wash, caused you to puke a few moments past that.

Then, the walking stopped. Far, far above, you could hear voices, muffled by flesh, shoe, and distance to be indecipherable. Where was this woman?

Before you can think further the toes about you clamp down, hard, grinding you between them and causing you to yelp in pain. The fabric, soft at normal size but much harsher at your scale, tears at you, burning your skin and shredding your clothes. The squeezing relents, but with a lurch the woman's foot is pulled from the shoe, dragging you along with it!

"...so would you be willing to sign this petition?" you hear a voice say, but the words hardly register as you're sent flying free from her foot. The light disorients you as you soar through the air, but the flight is cut short as you slam, hard, into rough concrete.

The giantesses ignore your plight. "Not right now," you hear from your former captress. "I am really going to be late, but if you're all still here when the day is through, I'll be sure to sign it." She slipped her foot back into its shoe; from down here, it looks much less intimidating. Then, she's gone, walking off into the distance with purpose in her steps. You didn't know her, and all she'd done so far was beat on you, but she was the first person you saw when you shrunk. That had to mean something, right? Suddenly, though, you're alone with the other giantess.

Well, not alone. Even from down here among the dirt and pebbles, you could see her comrades stomping about, waving signs and shouting about animal abuses. The lot of them looked like a bunch of unkempt hippies; not your crowd, and not the kind of people you would usually associate with. Still, they seemed to be all about peace and helpfulness, the exact kind of traits you were looking for in someone. And, to be truthful with yourself, you didn't have a whole lot of options.

Less options than you knew, actually, as the girl suddenly began stomping your way. Her feet, clad in nothing more than a skimpy pair of sandals, marched right to you. Her second step was right over you, crashing down right behind you. The force knocks you to your knees, but there she stops and stands still. Her heel, slightly cracked and dry, was right there, just a short climb away; if you wanted her attention, this was the way to do it. With a grunt, you stand up and run...
1313312.title: Shrinky Abuse

choices: You made it to her gross feet
Decided to try and make it over to Hazel instead.
13133121.content:
Crystal scoffed when the formal-looking woman had started to walk away. She knew that the woman had no intention of coming back. Still it was important to remain polite, at least so that their opinions could be taken seriously. Spotting her friend Hazel in the crowd, Crystal made her way over to her and stopped to talk. "Hey Hazel, any luck getting signatures?"

"Not yet," her slightly overweight, black haired friend responded. "I've only managed to get four so far." Crystal lifted her arm to scratch her head, and flakes of skin fell to her shoulder through her read, dreadlocked hair. This made Hazel wince as the body odor from her underarm was pretty strong. "Hey Crystal, I know you're trying to save water an all, but maybe you should think about showering more. This may not be healthy." "We talked about this. We all have to do our part for conservation. You should take a page out of my book, Hazel." With that the 30 year old red head rolled her eyes and walked away, as she spotted more employees heading into the building.
13133121.title: Crystal's Sandal

choices: Trapped under her foot
You try to think of an escape.
131331211.content:
You decided to go with what you had to work with, and dashed towards the sandal as the woman wearing it spoke to one of the other protestors. As you got to the rough surface of the sandal's sole, you could smell the rank, sour odor of her feet. You grimaced and tried to bare it as you climbed the back of her heel. Looking up. You could see her unshaved leg hairs concealed to the rest of the world by her worn, stained jeans.

The only way to get her attention was to climb higher up. You'd had your fill of feet for today. Just as you grabbed onto the rough, cracked skin of her heel, though, your entire world shakes. You see her hand reaching down and her foot tilts upward at a steep angle. Her fingers headed right for you, and rather than get crushed, you let go.

You see her scratch the spot you were just prior. Thinking you were going to fall to your death on the pavement below, you were surprised when instead there was a loud, wet sucking sound next to you as her grime-coated sandal was ever so slightly seperated from her odorous foot by gravity. To someone as small as you, the sudden displacement of air sucks you into the small (even by your standards) crevice. As you land on the steep incline that is her sandal, you try to find something to grab onto. But the insole is greased with sweat, grime, and skin flakes. The smell is also unbearable, and you are sent into a coughing fit as you slide down the sandal like it were a slip and slide, only more terrifying. As you got to the arxh of her foot, the sandal started to lower once more.
131331211.title: Amon the Grime

choices: You're on the clipboard
You're under her armpit
1313312112.content:
Crystal scoffed, sitting on a bench placed not far from the protest. She'd been doing that a lot, scoffing, and it was really throwing her aura out of whack. But it was just so irritating, having to deal with these snobby, stuck up nobodies who didn't understand the absolute, undeniable importance of saving Gaia. Even Hazel, that beautiful, beautiful snowflake, had trouble wrapping her mind around it all the time. Why couldn't they all just see?

She counted the signatures she'd collected all morning: four. It wasn't enough, no where near enough. Perhaps those eco-terrorists had the right idea...

A gust of wind caught her off guard, causing her to drop her clipboard to the ground. She stepped her sandal on it and pulled it towards her, missing the speck leaping from her swampy shoes to the paper.

Slipping the clipboard under her arm, Crystal headed back to the group. "Alright everyone!" she shout to her fellow hippies. "This isn't working, so we should split up. We meet back here tonight at 5. May the sky fill you with strength!"

Crystal took her clipboard and headed out towards the literature building. English students had soft hearts in her experence, and they could be easily made to join the side of Gaia.

She was unaware of the hitchhiker she'd picked up, now clinging to life on her person...
1313312112.title: Crystal's Break

choices: You remain on the sheet by the time Crystal brings it up to her next victim
When Crystal brings the board to bear, you are flung away
13133121121.content:
It's a rush, and you are bashed around a lot, but so long as you're not under some woman's foot, you'll take it. You clutch tight to whatever surface it is that you end up on, a rough white wall with dark, curved gouges cut out of it in patches. Wasn't there some thunderous talk about signing earlier? Yeah, this is some sort of clip-board paper...

Your shelter is far from steady, but you're in the open air, so you can live with it. Looking across to your left, you see a titanic expanse of flesh crushed up against the paper, only a few (real-world) inches from you - the arm of the goddess holding you up, whose crushing power you have only marginally escaped.

And you're far from safe now, as she could decide to bring the board out at any moment! No, relax, you tell yourself - this is the best place you could possibly be! People will look at this paper as they sign, and see you here. Recognition and rescue is a signature away. You just have to hope and pray that this titanic hippy is good at connecting with people.

She rumbles above you, and below - so far, far below - her toes flex, and she takes a step. Her roaring words of encouragement to her fellow giants echo through your ears as she launches herself off, and you relax under the care of Gaia. Sure, you're clinging by your fingertips, hoping your strength will hold out, but it'll all be over soon!
13133121121.title: Like the Goddess Gaia Herself

choices: You jump from the board to the stranger
You cling to the board depserately
While on a level field, you take the chance to jump to Crystal
131331211211.content:
The next person to approach Crystal was a strange one. Not a student, that was was sure. She was far too old, and not dressed in the random fashion that so many of the hippy's peers preferred. No, those clothes had cost a lot, and fit her like a dream. While usually not concerned with her own appearance, even Crystal found herself feeling frumpy in her presence!

So distracted was she, even as she offered the clipboard forward, she forgot her own spiel, so enraptured was she by the perfection the strange woman's face. Stammering was the best she could manage.

Without a clue as to the purpose of the clipboard, the woman raised an eyebrow and reached for the paper with her hand, hoping the words there would give an indication that the scruffy student was unable or unwilling to.
131331211211.title: Offered Up On A Plate

choices: You're stuck there until 5:00 while she collects more signatures.
A drop of sweat washes you out of her armpit.
13133121122.content:
You gasp for air as the gigantic signature sheet slides away. The hippie goddess had folded the clipboard under her arm, obliviously sandwiching you between a thick wall of paper and smelly flesh. You tried to grab onto the sheet, hoping for a first-class flight to salvation. Instead, you find that you're hopelessly glued to her enormous side. A marshy layer of sweat kept you stuck in place like a gnat on flypaper.

For a brief second, enough light floods in for you to see your surroundings. Frisbee-sized freckles dot endless stretches of pale skin. Your only company in this humid nook are unshaven vines of red hair. Far below, the enormous wing of a black bra peeks from under the titan’s tank top. You look up just time to see another wall of woman come crashing down.


Squish!


Everything goes dark as the mountain of her bicep shifts into place. You're engulfed by an avalanche of silky, damp flesh. All at once, you're smothered inside the activist's gargantuan armpit.

The surprisingly soft crevice reeks of body odor. You think back to your time trapped at her feet. The smell here isn't as bad as but it's still pungent. It would've been strong at normal size but now it’s absolutely suffocating. Your entire world is slicked with sweat. You can almost taste her feminine musk with every strained breath.
Doesn't this chick ever shower?

Rhythmic shockwaves are sent through her titanic body as she begins to walk. Her arm swings a bit with her stride, grinding against her torso. You're smooshed and rolled between expanses of slightly doughy skin. The giant’s body heat broils you in her soupy perspiration. You remember where you'd been just a few minutes ago in a sweaty haze. Maybe her sandal hadn't been so bad...
13133121122.title: Under the Arm

choices: Crystal's arm movements send the tiny man flying toward her head
Crystal's arm movements throw the tiny man toward the other person
Crystal's arm movements fling the tiny man into a tree
131331211221.content:
Some of those rude individuals had really damaged Crystal's calm. So unreceptive to her suggestions, more willing to shout abuse than to take a pamphlet! Yet anger was wrong, and it wouldn't do to let it fester and grow within her. She'd have to centre herself and re-embrace her inner goddess before she could try talking to others again.

There were a few hours to go before five, and around the back of the English building was a secluded grove of trees, perhaps the most naturally blessed area of the campus. Often she had come here, where none of the temporally-minded student body ever bothered to go. They were so caught up in their modern ways of thinking, they couldn't see how the planet was suffering!

Crystal could. She settled herself down into a cross-legged pose, elbows to her side with her forearms resting across her thighs, fingers clasped in positions of meditative amplification.

She breathed slowly, allowing every breath of life the most time to roll around in her expanding lungs before expelling it as a blessing to the plant-life around her. All thoughts washed from her head, as she distanced herself from the higher thought processes that cursed mankind, becoming once more a blissfully natural animal.

She only roused herself when she felt ready, thanking Gaia for the alarm before she rose to her feet, ready to continue the good work.

Clipboard under her arm, she strode forth from the copse, head held high and feeling like an unstoppable force, radiating with power before which no human could stand. No need for a smile as she approached the first potential recruit, sweeping her arms wide as if to embrace them.
131331211221.title: The Calm of Meditation

choices: Down below, you approach Makenna
Down below, you just want to get clear of these crowds!
13133122.content:
Crystal scoffed when the formal-looking woman had started to walk away. She knew that the woman had no intention of coming back. Still it was important to remain polite, at least so that their opinions could be taken seriously. Spotting her friend Hazel in the crowd, Crystal made her way over to her and stopped to talk. "Hey Hazel, any luck getting signatures?"

The hippy wasn't the only one scoffing that day. As she gathered her fellow protestors and suggested they split up to cover more ground, the area was taken up by a smaller group of cleaner women, their leader flicking her blonde locks over her shoulder to maximise the effect of her scoffage.

"Ew," Makenna mock-whispered to her friends, "they look as bad as they smell! You'd think, if they wanted to get people to listen to them, they'd make a little effort!"

Makenna had certainly done so. In contrast to Crystal, her legs were clean-shaven and deeply tanned, in full sight above thin sandals and below tight denim cut-offs, her taut torso barely contained by a sleeveless pink top, and she wore a beaming, brilliant smile on her carefully made-up face.

"I'm sure we'll do much better than them, girls!" she said, to a mixed chorus of giggles, cheers and rapid clapping. "Does everyone have their pamphlets?"

The group spread out a little across the area vacated by the hippies, approaching passing students with bright grins and welcoming body language as they made their pitches, handing out papers and having quick discussions.

"It's a pledge to Jesus," Makenna explained to one boy, clasping his hand in hers after he took her pamphlet, and leaning in close to speak. "Abstaining from sex until marriage makes us glorious in His eyes."

If she saw any hypocrisy in making such advances while preaching abstinence, Makenna made no sign of it. Just as she made no sign of having noticed the tiny man whose personal space her feet had invaded...
13133122.title: Pamphlet Season

choices: Makenna's a hard worker and spends the whole protest on her feet.
Makenna's a better supervisor than worker, and quickly sits back
131331221.content:
"I guess this is better," you said to yourself as you hoisted yourself onto the momentarily-still sole of the sandal. "This new girl is certainly... cleaner than that hippy chick." Unliked the rough, dirt-blackened callouses that made up her sole, the arch that rose before you was soft and pink and smelt slightly of lavender.

She shifts forward and you tumble to the ground. You hold back a Yelp when you find yourself tucked under her arch, the wrinkles you were admiring before now just an arm's length above.

Before you get a chance to find your footing she shifts again, lifting her foot high into the air before bringing it back down, resting it on the tips of her toes as she seduces the stranger far out of your vision. Suddenly her new, smooth insole seems like a curse as you slide down along its slope. Your sight of her arch is almost immediately replaced by the redder ball of her foot. There's less room, and your slide is suddenly slowed as her skin presses into from above, bringing you to a stop, vertically hanging under this sorority girl's foot.

Her foot comes down. You scream under the pressure, feeling every bit of give your body has. At least with the mother before you had space between her toes, but with the ball of her foot directly on you you had nothing. She lifts her foot again, this time to walk elsewhere, and you feel yourself adhere to her sole and the slight layer of sweat and lotion.

There's a moment of respite as her foot swings forward, but then it comes back down and the pain starts anew. Every joint in your body pops, and you feel your legs twist in unnatural direction as her sandal finds purchase.

She's back in the air. You struggle, knowing what's coming, and find motion in an arm. You swing it forward, clawing for-

She steps down. Your elbow is pushed back, slamming into your jaw as she compresses you beneath her. A tooth chips, but with no space to pry your mouth open you're forced to swallow the blood that quickly pools around you.

You rise once more. Quicker, you need to be quicker, and so you swing your arm forward and jam it flat against the warm flesh, reaching above your head.

Not a moment later she's back on the ground. Your shoulder strains, the forward sliding of the treadless sandal causing her foot to slip just slightly, just enough to yank at the speck beneath her, just enough to make it fear being ripped in half.

It's been literal seconds but already you're already running out of strength. She steps onward, bashing you flat as you claw along her sole, inching forward to the relative safely of her toes, one handful of skin at a time.

Finally, she stops, standing still over you once more. But you've done it, and with a final tug and a wet sucking sound you pull your head free, sucking in the air that filtered down from above.

To your left was a towering strap, the fabric that held shoe to foot. It ascended into the nearly vaulted ceilings of her toes, and you realized that you found yourself resting in the little gap beneath the curl of her second and third toes.

You choked back a pained laugh, as the toes clench around you.
131331221.title: Almost familiar territory

choices: Against all odds, you remain with Makenna
Predictably, you have been thrown to the ground
In a twist of fate, you have been passed to another
1313312211.content:
The procession of guys that Makenna approached passed by in a blur, the girl effortlessy moving from one to the next, leaving with a wink, and approaching with wide, appealing eyes. An outsider might have called it flirting or, if they were cruel, teasing. But to Makenna she was merely doing her best to promote virginity, rising up on the balls of her feet to whisper Christ's teachings in the ears of the taller males.

And when each had been spoken to, it was with a spring in her step that the moved to the next! After all, the girl figured, there was no reason why she couldn't get a good workout while handing out fliers! In the periods without any students approaching she even did a few jumps to attract passers-by, ignorant both of the attracting force of her bouncing bosom and the tiny man who had been at her toes...
1313312211.title: Makenna the Busy Body

choices: ...goes home
...heads to a cafe
...goes to see her boyfriend
13133122111.content:
There's probably some lesson to be learned here, you muse. There's little to do but muse as the oblivious overseers of your fate, those gargantuan toes whose never-ceasing movements alternately squeeze and pummel you. You've lost track even of which toe you're under at this moment, as you are given no chance to get your bearings after each step, stomp or idle flex. It's simply a miracle that not a single step of this woman had pressed you beneath her full, fleshy fury, condemning you to death beneath her foot.

So you muse. The hippy you had connected with earlier had been vile, truly smelly and unpleasant. This woman is her total opposite, clean to a degree where even now, underfoot and taking damage, you can appreciate the scented oils covering her immaculate skin.

And which is it that is tormenting you now with unceasing movement, tossing you here and there beneath her astronomical weight? That's as far as your musing goes, as drawing a coherent conclusion is beyond you.

Every now and then you half-heartedly slap a hand against the ceiling of skin, as if she could feel that, realise you're down here and cease her torture. Why couldn't you even be thrown free by her steps, where the mercies of open air would at least be one final mercy?

Instead, you remain with Makenna throughout her pamphleting, and when she eventually...
13133122111.title: Are We Done Yet?  Please?

131332.content:
As Jenna's foot gets snug in her shoe, she feels the tiniest of sensations on her sole. It kind of felt like a little bump? No, smaller. Just a little imperfection on the insole.

She shifted her foot back and forth. The shoe was a tad bit small, but it was such a sweet gift from Tim that she had to wear it at least a few times. If only it wasn't so cramped. She pressed down with her whole weight, trying to make a bit of room.

"Oh!" She felt something, a little prick of wetness. Maybe that little lump from earlier was a small bug, and her wriggling had popped it. She certainly hoped not. It'd be such a hassle to clean insect guts off her nylons.

Sitting at a chair, Jenna slipped her foot out and set it on her knee. Her eyes scanned back and forth, looking for the telltale splotch that she'd felt. They miss the tiniest of blood stains, hardly a dot on the dark fabric.

"Okay mom, let's go!" Emily was standing at the door, bouncing impatiently. The bug slipped from her mind as she re-shoed and headed towards the door. She never would figure out that she snuffed a life out, but that was probably for the best.
131332.title: Irritant

choices: Try the TV room
Try the bathroom
Try upstairs
132.content:
The click of the door lock signals that the last of them, the mother and youngest daughter, have left. You're alone now, the size of a speck in a house for giants.

Fun.

Aimless, you leave the kitchen. The carpet of the living room is a bit of a hassle, but you can't stay in one spot. At least, not until you've figured this whole situation out.

The TV room was nice, if a bit cozy. Couch, a couple of recliners, a coffee table, and the TV. They did have a nice surround sound set up, which was cool. Not that you could use any of that stuff.

The bathroom was pretty much as expected. Sink, toilet, shower, cabinet. It was nice and clean, however. Good for them.

This little house tour was all you could do to keep from going crazy. Seriously, you are a bug right now. Oh god, you hoped they didn't have any pets.

With a shiver, you decide you need a shelter, or at least a base of operations until you can find a way to contact the skyscraper people. The two rooms you've seen seemed like pretty good options, but there was a staircase as well. It was carpeted, so a climb would be possible, but what if they came home during your ascent?

You're not in much of a rush, so after thinking it over for a bit, you decide to...
132.title: All by myself

choices: Wait
Leave
Sneak
1321.content:
After strolling across the road for what appear to be hours, Winnie stopped and sat down. Her feet were aching after all that traveling from a agricultural area all the way to this suburbia road. Unfortunately, the inn that she stayed back at the previous area wasn't the most pleasant place to spend the night at; the bed was almost as hard as a rock and not to mention a heated argument from the next room as well as some loud music from the ceiling kept her awake all night. As a result, she's nearly drowsy and decided to find another place to relax for a bit. This suburban community might have a nice home for her to stay in, but finding one that's suitable is a little difficult.

"Oh crap, is there any place that'll look nice enough for me to rest? I can't travel at this condition." she groaned while trying to stay up.

Winnie stood up and look behind to see if this house could be perfect place. The house is pretty much a standard two-floor building that was both brown and red in color and other than that, it's nothing special but she had enough. "Screw this, I really won't care much anymore. I need a place to catch a break." she said as she stumbled across the concrete path that leads to the house.

She approached the door and can see a sign that reads "Stevensons". "I wonder if they'll be nice enough to invite me in..." she said and ringed the doorbell.

No answer.

She ringed again.

No answer.

After a good ten times, she stands there and waited.

No answer.

"Dammit, looks like they're not even home!" she said and left the doorway. She thought about waiting for the owners at the sidewalk, but that'll probably take a few hours. She could simply find another home to get there but she's already done enough walking.

Normally she doesn't do anything illegal, but seeing how she's desperate to get on the road again, she could.....just sneak inside.
1321.title: Winnie The Wanderer

choices: You run to the stranger's boot
You run to the stranger's bag
You run for cover beneath the furniture
13213.content:
Well, it seems as if they have no pet - you've been wandering the house for over an hour now with no disturbance. Good.

Seems like you've ended up back in the living room, the home cinema system rising above you like the most mega megaplex of all time. Or something. If only you could turn it on somehow, at least you wouldn't be so bored right now.

A scraping tears through the silence, and you look far upwards to see a shadow passing across the lace curtains of the front window. The noise finally registers as being that selfsame window opening, and the realisation that the family left it unlocked.

An immense hiking boot crashes down as an intruder climbs in through the window, and you stumble back a few steps, still not entirely used to the immensity of regular-sized people. It is difficult to make out details, but this stranger is wrapped in thick clothing: rugged combat trousers covered in pockets, a coat similarly bedecked and massive gloves.

There's no chance to look at the face, as the figure drops its backpack to the ground, a mountain that bulges with its full contents, a metal cup and thermos rattling against each other on the strap holding them.

Well, you're going to have to act soon, and decide how you should react to this criminal newcomer.
13213.title: Intruder Alert

choices: She slept for an hour (Stay here for a while)
She slept until noon (Time to go)
She woke up from a sudden sound
132131.content:
Winnie looks outside from the window in case anyone saw her entering the home. Luckily for her, nobody saw her as the streets were pretty empty right now. "Perfect!" she said as she takes her sight on the room and looked around.

The living room looks pretty cool as the TV seems to have a bunch of fancy speakers around it. There were also some cozy chairs too and everything. Other than that, it's basically typical stuff you usually see in common TV rooms.

She walk to the kitchen and by the looks of it, they must have recently ate, judging from the fact that there were a few crumbs on the table. "I wonder if they got any nice food?" she asked herself. She sure will like to have a snack but that will risk the owners of finding out about the intruder in their home. The kitchen itself looks clean but there's absolutely nothing special about it.

Winnie looks at the clock on the wall to see the exact time. It was about 9:30 am so they probably just left a little while ago. This means that she could have plenty of time to rest here before they arrive. She left the kitchen and head back into the living room to lay on the couch that was in between the chairs. Taking her boots off, she rest on top of it. "It's about time I given my feet a rest after all that walking in those boots." she said with a sigh. She look at the TV and thought that maybe she could watch something but she should really get the rest she needed.

She closed her eyes and falls asleep. She wonder what she could do here if she managed to wake up early.
132131.title: Rest Time

choices: ...upstairs to do something fun there
...outside to look around for a bit
reader's choice
1321311.content:
You hold on to the boot as the giant wandered around the kitchen and back to the living room. You still don't get a good look of this stranger's face due to fact that you'll probably fall off if you do. Just then, the giant suddenly removes his/her boots and began to rest on the couch. After that, you finally got a good look of this titan before your eyes.

Aside from the accessories you already saw, you finally able to make out the face of the intruder.

The giant has long messy red hair, a pair of green eyes, and freckles. You soon realized that this giant appears to be a young woman in her mid-20s. Now that you know about her gender, the question is what is she even doing here? You don't what care less about it and decided to try and get her attention, maybe she could be nice enough to help you out.

"It's about time I given my feet a rest after all that walking in those boots." her voice echoed all around you like a choo-choo train crossing the railway and just like that, she falls asleep.

"Looks like I'm going to have to wake her up first." you groan, knowing that'll probably take hours to do so. Nonetheless, you carry on as you jumped off her boot and go straight to your destination.

After thirty minutes of running, you finally reach the couch. You see her hand just hanging from above and quickly thought about climbing up her arm to her face. Luckily for you, the couch was easy to climb so you eventually leap off and grab onto her gloved pinkie. "Alright, it's all or nothing!" you said and start scaling across the hand.

Unfortunately, the glove was a little too sweaty for you to hold on as you constantly slip each time you try to hold, you almost fall off at one point. Because of this, you almost wasted another good thirty minutes when you very slowly climbed across it.

Just as you reached the wristband of the glove, the entire arm suddenly moved. She must be waking up and you're still on her hand. You can hear her monstrously loud yawn and voice:

"Man that was a good sleep and boy I'm I all rested. Looks like there's plenty of time left for me to stay here for a bit."

You watch as the woman rise up like a titaness and (along with you) goes...
1321311.title: Hiking The Hiker

choices: The man falls into an empty glove
The man had fallen off in a cupboard
The man falls off onto the sandwich preparation area
13213113.content:
An hour's nap: now Winnie was hungry. Padding through to the kitchen, she opened up a few cupboards to see what food she could turn into a snack. No time for a big meal, and she didn't want to take so much as to make the family realise they'd been stolen from.

Loaf of bread in hand, the intruder dragged a knife from a drawer, ready to make herself a tasty sandwich. Almost as an afterthought, Winnie peeled off her gloves, little aware of the tiny man that had been clinging to one of them...
13213113.title: Refueling

choices: With some luck, you made it out
She puts it back on just before you can escape
132131131.content:
You ended up falling inside one of the woman's gloves after the she took them off. You gave one final shout so that she can hear you but of course, you were too small to be heard and disappeared inside.

You fall straight into the index part of the huge glove and land on the surface with a thud. Thankfully, the glove was (kinda) cushiony enough to prevent you from getting hurt. Your location shook as the giant woman drops her glove onto the counter; next to the dish where she's making her meal. After all of that's done, you got up from the ground and stood up.

It was humid around here; the woman must've worn these for a long time. You could feel her body heat in this glove; almost enough to make you sweat a little. You don't want to spend so much time here so you ran as fast as you can to escape before something happens.

Unfortunately, you were very small, and small enough for you to take several minutes or even more to escape. It would take a miracle to get out of here in time before she puts it back on.
132131131.title: Into The Glove

choices: Upstairs
Backyard
Basement
1321311312.content:
Winnie have completed her sandwich: a ordinary ham sandwich with lettuce. "It looks bland but I don't really want to overdo it." she said to herself. She puts everything back where they belong and went to the dining table to eat her food. She begins to eat her lunch, thinking to herself "At least mines taste better than the ones back in the inn and this is only just an average sandwich. I swear, they probably have very little experience with cooking."

After minutes of thinking of that inn, she finally finished her snack. She picks up the plate and went to the sink to wash it. She washes good, making sure no traces are left behind. She puts it back where she found it after she's done. She looked at the clock once more to see if she has enough time left.

10:45 AM

"There's still lots of time left." she said smiling "Since I got tons of energy left, I guess it's time for something fun."

She puts her gloves back on and goes to her destination.
1321311312.title: Snacktime

choices: You managed to get out and grab hold onto the woman
You managed to get out and fall off
You couldn't get out and give up
13213113121.content:
You were stuck.

You can barely even move after this woman puts her glove back on. If you would have scaled her boots while she still have them on, you will never be in this inside here. You don't know what's happening outside and you probably don't care to even know at this point as you were starting to sweat from the humid of her body heat.

"I just hope I'm able to get of here." you said. Even if you did. you'll might fall of this giantess but that's still worth the risk, you can't stay in here for too long.

You struggle to retain your moment at this point. This was tricky for you as the woman's glove was quite tight, but you managed to briefly squirm around the inside.

"I...just...hope..I...could...make....it...in...time..." you panted as you go. The woman's skin was soft but getting pressed onto it makes it very difficult to move across. You have no idea how long this take unlike simply walking across it so you hope you can escape in time.
13213113121.title: Trapped In A Glove

choices: You fell into a kid's food
You fell into a parent's food
You just missed the cereal and hit the table.
133.content:
It was an unreal experience, watching the family assemble for breakfast. Your hiding spot, near a vent in the room's corner, also happened to be right near the entrance, giving you a great view of how small you were. Their massive feet, bare, socked, nylon-ed, stomped past you. How were you supposed to get their attention when the smallest toe of the smallest person was the size of a car? You lean back on the vent cover and put your face in your hands.

Click

What was that? It came from behind, from the vent...

You turn to run, but the gust of hot air catches you and sends you spinning into the sky. Hot air rises, after all, and you're caught in the biggest updraft of your life. You, and some pieces of dust that were mostly smaller than you, tumbled away from the corner, into the center of the room. Most of the debris fell harmlessly to the floor, though a few did collide with the giants.

Your fate was different. Perhaps because of your density or your odd shape, you drifted towards the table. towards the family's food. "No no no!" Gently, you began to sink to the bowl in front of the bouncing, skyscraper sized little girl as she struggled with the milk carton. "Please, no!" You flapped your arms, alternating between fish-like and bird-like motions, but your path was set by air currents, not you.

"So, what's going on after school?" From nowhere an older woman appears, the family's mother. She grabbed the carton from her daughter's hands and began pouring it into the cereal below. You screamed again but the torrent flooded by, missing you by only an inch. Still, its power sent you hurdling away, further in the air and across the table.

"I have soccer practice," states the teen girl as you soar by. Her mouth stretches open, pulling in huge current of air. She's yawning, without even bothering to cover her mouth? The force is strong, pulling you towards the soaking cavern. "Stop! Stop!" Your shouts fall away in the wind, but as you pass her lips she exhales, pushing an endless volume of morning breath in your direction. You hurdle away, back to the unknown.

"Great. Do I have to wait around for her?" It's the teen boy this time who's words throw you about. It smells no better than the girl's did, but at least he was gracious enough to not suck you in his mouth.

"No, I can pick her up. What are you doing, though, that it's an issue?" The dad speaks, but despite his greater size, you're blown about less roughly. In fact, it seems like you've descended past mouth level. You realize what's going to happen. The bowl of cereal looms larger than an Olympic pool, and the rough milky seas is all that's below. But who's bowl is it?
133.title: Jet stream

choices: You were in Jake's meal
You were in Brianna's meal
You were in Emily's meal
1331.content:
"Well, good luck with the game tonight. I've got to go." Wiping his mouth with the back of his hand, Tim stands from the table and moves for the exit.

"Later."

"Bye Papa!"

"Have a good day, hun.'

"Crunch crunch gulp. Bye dad. See you tonight," Brianna says, finishing her mouthful of cereal. She plunges the spoon back into the bowl, hurriedly scooping up another bite. She had to finish before Jake...

She looked over and saw him with his bowl to his lips, drinking the milky remains. Milk dribbled onto his chin as he hurriedly gulped to last drops of breakfast. He slammed the bowl on the table, quickly standing up. "Buurp! Alright, I'm done. Looks like I win today, Sissy."

"That's not fair! You know he always stinks up the bathroom. Make him wait, let me go first."

Jenna, preoccupied with cleaning Tim's spot, only sighed. "You know the rules, Brianna."

With a laugh, Jake turned and headed to the restroom. Smugly, he called back, "That's right, I finished first, so I'm in the right here."

Brianna slouched in her seat. She was so close to finishing, too. Dejectedly, she finished eating.

While Emily could tell there was some drama flying about, she was way more interested in her food. She was careful to eat around the colorful marshmallows, saving the titular lucky charms for last. Getting that blast of sugary sweetness was so worth the effort.

In the bathroom, Jake was just finishing up with the toilet. Standing over the sink, he washed his hands and smiled to himself in the mirror. Nothing in his teeth... Shrugging, he grabbed the mouthwash. He swished it around his mouth, figuring it be'd a fine replacement for brushing this morning.

Brianna was outside the door when he finished. "It's all ready for you, Your Grace." He flashed her the biggest shit-eating grin before heading to his room.

Covering her nose, Brianna stormed into the room. It stank alright, thanks to his insistence on a morning dump, but it had been worse, and she'd live. She urinated quickly, then grabbed for her toothbrush. A quick brushing, hardly hitting all of the important spots, then she was out of the room.

Emily's next, potty-ing and brushing with the help of Jenna. It's a thorough brushing job, if nothing else. They finish, and Jenna sends Emily to her room so she could get dressed for the day.
1331.title: Morning routine

choices: you were coughed out of/glued somewhere in Jenna's mouth
you were flushed down Jenna's throat...
1332.content:
Jenna stirred her cereal as she watched her son waffle in his seat at the question that was asked of him. She took a bite, savoring the honey taste. Judging from the blush on Jake's face, she thought she could piece together what it was.

"Uh-oh, does Jakey have a date?" she asked teasingly. Instantly, Jake's face flushed with embarrassment and his sisters burst into laughter. Jenna spooned up some more cereal as the grilling began.

"Oh my god, who is she?!" Brianna asked.

"Shut up." Jake replied.

"Is she pretty?!" Emily chirped.

"Stop!" Jake yelped.

Tim laughed. "Well you're going to have to introduce us sometime you know."

"Ugh!!" Jake wolfed down his breakfast as fast as he could and ran from the table to avoid further torture, leaving his family behind to laugh and speculate. Jenna finished up the rest of her own breakfast and walked to the sink to wash her bowl out. As she did she winced, feeling something caught in the back of her throat and began coughing harshly.

"You okay honey?" Tim called from the table as Jenna poured a glass of water and gulped it down. The coughing resumed.

"Yeah," she replied, "something just went down the wrong pipe I guess." With that the family got up from the table and began to head out and get the day started.
1332.title: Breakfast: Revelations

choices: One of the people
A piece of furnature
13321.content:
Being eaten sucked. If you ever got back to normal, you'd apologize to every bite you'd eat. You'd avoided the spoon for a while, but it got you in the end. The mother's mouth opened, her eyes locked somewhere else, and you were sent into the stinky abyss.

Her tongue kept you in constant motion, flinging you and the cereal around. Just barely did you manage to avoid death by pearly whites by jamming yourself between two of her molars. From there you watched the rest of her meal, the white milk sloshing by and the brown cereal being ground up above you.

But as she got up, she found you. Her tongue came for you, smashing into you and trying to yank you out while you tried to stay put. The tongue won, and you went tumbling to the back of her throat.

You still had a bit of fight left, and as you fell you kicked and scratched for all you were worth. It seemed to work. Her lips part, the back of her mouth rumbles, and...

She coughed. It was loud. No, not loud. It was deafening. As a hurricane pushes from her throat, all you can hear is the ringing of your ears. It was like someone set off a grenade next to your eardrum.

You, and a bunch of spittle, whizzed out past her lips. She had a hand in front, but you slipped between the fingers into the open air. Clutching your head and trying not to cry, you go soaring back into the world.

Soaking with sticky saliva, you crash and stick to...
13321.title: Cannon Fire

choices: Jenna was throwing up into a toilet at work
Jenna was throwing up into a sink at work
13322.content:
In the complete darkness of this woman's stomach, you sobbed heavily. Everything spun and churned, throwing you this way and that, thoroughly covering you in the thick paste of what once was breakfast. The combination of the fierce heat and milk and cereal became a thick sour bog and you found yourself retching whenever you got a breath in. As everything rocked back and forth you could still hear the sounds from outside, and the giant family talking. This oblivious woman devoured you, a human being and didn't even realize it. She's just carrying on with the rest of her day, none the wiser to the atrocity she just committed. This realization just served to upset you even more-- no one would ever find you or realize what happened to you.

"Hey!! Help! Please! I'm,,,, I'm inside you! You ate me! Please! Let me out!" you screamed.

The only response your captor gave was the burbling groans of her digestive system and the thump thump of her heartbeat above. There was more swaying and rocking, and you found yourself sinking into the churning muck. Your crying turned into hysterical laughter and you wondered how long you had before the acids in her stomach broke you down into nothing.

It was difficult to tell how much time was passing in your prison cell, but soon there was thick sloppy sounds coming from above. You whimpered in the dark as globs of slime poured all around and over you, forcing you down into the swamp of the half-filled stomach. More and more poured down.

'She's eating...' you realized, feeling even more hopeless.

Another glob of chewed up food landed on, this one much larger than the others. It landed with a harsh slap, burying you deep in the goop. The stuff got in every orifice and you shuddered as you could even taste some of what it used to be. Some sort of... seafood. Lobster?

More churning. You broke the surface of the hot slime, gagging and sputtering. You could feel yourself tingling all over. The acids were no doubt getting to work now. Everything swayed and rocked more. You could hear muffled laughter and voices from outside. She was talking to other women. They were laughing, happy. All of them oblivious to the private hell going on down here. It must've been lunch time already.

Feeling weak, you closed your eyes and laid down into the muck. Hopefully you could at least fall asleep and die peacefully. Before long however, everything began to grumble and groan around you. Your prison started rocking back and forth, very violently now. What was she doing?

Before you had a chance to even speculate, everything contracted and collapsed around you. You screamed as the contents of this stomach, including you were swept up and forced upward at breakneck speed.

Light flooded your limited vision and--!!
13322.title: Upchucked

choices: You were spewed into the bathroom
You were spewed onto Jenna
133222.content:
I am never letting Cynthia take me to Red Lobster again, Jenna thought as she wiped the gunk from her lips. There was no other way to put it; she had made a mess. Her lunch had come back up, and it had come up quickly. Most of the puke had filled the sink, but more than enough had splashed out, with chunks speckled along the mirrors and counters. And, to her major disgust, up the front of her blouse.

A few minutes later, she was back in her office making a call. "Hello, custodial department? This is admissions. We need a clean up in the staff bathroom over here."

"Why, what's happened?"

"I... Someone vomited all over the women's bathroom. It's everywhere. Do you think you could send someone over to clean it up?"

Silence. "Yeah, I'll get someone on it. Anything else?"

"No, thanks." Jenna put the phone down, then took a second to look at herself. It wasn't a pretty sight, and it didn't smell much better. She was going to have to head home and change. Luckily she was the head of her department; no one would be coming around to ask about her temporary absence.

The drive was quick. Standing in front of her wardrobe, Jenna realized that the blouse was too far gone to save. The shoes and skirt could be washed, but the sheer amount of spew on her shirt made it only suitable for the trash. She set it aside, slipping into a new outfit, and grabbing a more comfortable pair of heels.

Without any more trouble, she left the house, chucking the blouse into the trash as she walked to her car.
133222.title: A mess

choices: you dive off the sink
the sponge lands on top of you
1332221.content:
You come to, choking and gagging, spitting out the bile burning in your throat. You aren't sure if it's yours or the woman's. Retching, you realize you can see and breathe. You're covered in head to toe in vomit, and so is the surface all around you. The massive mirror towering over you like a building and faucet looming ahead makes you realize you're in a restroom.

"She puked.... she puked! Hahaha!" you start laughing hysterically and fall backwards into the slop, smiling and not even bothered by the oppressive stench in the air. What were the chances of that? You were just given a new lease on life. But now you need to figure out how to get down from this sink, and where was the woman..?

Before another thought could occupy your head the bathroom swings open violently and a massive custodian thunders in, pushing a mop cart filled with filthy water. You panic, realizing she's hear to clean up this mess and likely you with it! You want to try screaming for help, but your throat still burns from acidic contents of your previous prisoner's stomach tract, and a glance up at the janitor reveals that she has headphones in and is humming to the music. So instead you begin to clamber up the side of the sink as fast as you can.

What feels like rain drops begin to pour all around you and a shadow darkens things. You look up and see a gargantuan sponge being lowered towards your person and shriek. At the edge of the sink, miles and miles below you can see a waste can filled with crumpled up tissues and napkins. Could it possibly break your fall?
1332221.title: The Danger Never Stops

choices: You were hanging onto the earring, and are now in the janitor's pocket
You have fallen out of the trash bag, and are now in the hallway
13322211.content:
Lysa pushed the heavy bucket of water into the restroom, humming along to the latest track from Deth N’ Thumps. Cleaning up other people’s shit (literally) was not her idea of a dream job, but she gaining employment was a stipulation of her release on parole, and she was not keen on going back to the pokey. Six months was far too long for that retail theft conviction. She was only 24, how dare they take away her precious youth like that! Well, that, and the drugs they found in her pocket. She was holding them for a friend, really…

Tapping her booted feet along to the beat, she was grateful that they at least allowed her to listen to music. Not only did it help pass the time, but this way she didn’t have to listen to those stuck-up muckety-mucks talk about their vacation homes and ex-husbands. It was bad enough that she had to watch them strut around in outfits that cost more than what she made in a month, while she had to schlep around in this smelly janitor’s outfit that covered up all her beautiful tattoos. It always amazed her what slobs these people really were. If she could get away with it, she’d love to spit in their soap dispenser, but she didn’t think Officer O’Malley would look kindly upon her if she got fired. Best to do as little as possible without losing her job while doing the small things to make these place as horrible as possible for those rich bastards. For example, she hasn’t changed the water in her mop bucket all month, and this pile of puke will make a nice addition to the toxic stew that already contained the liquefied remains of Mary’s rotten casserole that the old bitch dumped all over the break room floor. Lysa giggled as she imagined painting the walls of this hellhole with a torrid mixture of vomit and diarrhea. But still, there was work to do.

As she pushed the mop around the sink, the janitor noticed something sparkling in the trash bin. Reaching her gloved hand toward the mass of balled-up papers, she noticed that someone had carelessly discarded a diamond earring amongst the trash. She could not possibly care less if one of these stupid broads lost a piece of jewelry worth more than her car. In fact, the diamond was a good size, and Lysa could certainly sell it for a good sum. She quickly pocketed the earring, before bagging up the rest of the trash and tossing it out into the hall. A little bit of paper and dirt fell out of the bag and onto to the floor, but she couldn’t care less, she was too busy thinking of what she could buy herself once she pawned that earring. She smiled to herself again as she cleaned up the rest of the putrid vomit.
13322211.title: Freefalling

choices: You fall into the pocket with the earing
You land elsewhere on her
133222111.content:
"Fuck!" you shout, diving out of the way of the wall of sponge mop. It crashed down in the muck, creating a wave of puke that washed over you. You're forced off your feet, stumbling towards the edge of the counter. For a moment you catch a glance at the woman doing the cleaning, her dyed hair and black fingernails catching your eye, before you plummet off the side.

The paper towels, most still damp from use, should be pretty great at stopping your fall. You angle yourself towards them, trying hard not to think about where they'd been. After all, you're probably still filthier than any of them. The garbage bin fills your vision, and you fall in.

At terminal velocity, you tear through the first layer of wet paper. The tissue behind it stops you, and your little body bounces off it. You are sent tumbling, bouncing hard off balls of towels as you fall through the trash. Then you stop, a cold metal hook pressing hard onto your back. You turn your head back, looking at the golden, diamond encrusted earring that had caught you by the shirt. This was trouble. Your arms were completely immobilized, pinned to your side by the taut shirt.

Still, you weren't one to give up easily, especially not after you survived those hours in the gut. Up above, through the layers of waste and paper, the janitor girl still worked; she was your ticket out of here. "Hey!" you shout, hopeful it'll pierce the silence of the bathroom. "I'm in the garbage! Hey! Give me a hand!"

It almost surprises you that she turns and looks down. Her bored expression twists into surprise, and quicker than you can fully comprehend you are being pressed between the blue rubber of her gloved digits. Her eyes get terrifyingly close, and you watch as she scans the earring. "Miss, I'm down he-mmpphh!"

Her thumb shifts, pinning your head. You begin to struggle, but all you manage to do is tear your shirt. Her grip releases, and you, now freed from the earring's clutches, hurdle down as she slides her prize into her pocket.
133222111.title: Buried Treasure

choices: You are stuck in the noxious gym bag
You are left on the floor of the employee locker room
1332221111.content:
With the bathroom now sparkling clean (more or less [that’s as good as it’s going to get, alright]), Lysa threw the trash bag onto her cart and began rolling it down the hallway.
